page.title: 10The Cemetery Ipswich
page.content: The Cemetery is situated to the north of Ipswich next to the railway line. The Cemetery in Ipswich is approximately 1km by 475m.The cemetery has been going since 1859 and the graves are still being dug.The most common gravestone is made of granite,because marble is too expensive. There are three chapels in the Cemetery one in the North part, one West and one crematoria.The chapels are approximately 6 by 12m.80% of the people who die are cremated.The commonest hymn sung is Psalm 23 which is The Lord Is My Shepherd.
